sen.j: 東坊城 徳長（ひがしぼうじょう よしなが、明治2年5月17日 (旧暦)（1869年6月26日） - 大正11年（1922年）8月8日）は、日本の華族。
sen.e: Yoshinaga HIGASHIBOJO (June 26, 1869 - August 8, 1922) was a member of the Japanese peerage.
Yoshinaga HIGASHIBOJO (June 26, 1869 - August 8, 1922) was a member of the Japanese peerage.
Yoshinaga HIGASHIBOJO (June 26, 1869 - August 8, 1922) was a member of the Japanese peerage.

sen.j: 御歌会奉行、貴族院議員を務める。
sen.e: He served as Outakai-bugyo (the superintendent of the Imperial Poetry Reading Party) and as a parliament member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers).
He served as Outakai-bugyo (the superintendent of the Imperial Poetry Reading Party) and as a parliament member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers).
He served as Outakai-bugyo (the superintendent of the Imperial Poetry Reading Party) and as a parliament member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers).
His official court rank was Viscount of the Senior Third Rank with the Third Order of Merit.
sen.cmt: 原文「位階勲等」は「正三位・勲三等」として訳出
sen.e: His last rank was viscount (according to Japanese Ranks and Orders).
sen.cmt: 翻訳者が指摘するように原文の日本語がおかしいですが、このような記事の場合「官位は」はlast rank and post（ここではpostが紹介されていないので省略）を意味します。
sen.e: His last rank was viscount (according to Japanese Ranks and Orders).

sen.j: 大学頭東坊城任長の子。
sen.e: Yoshinaga was a son of Tadanaga HIGASHIBOJO, who was Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education).
Yoshinaga was a son of Tadanaga HIGASHIBOJO, who was Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education).
Yoshinaga was a son of Tadanaga HIGASHIBOJO, who was Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education).
His childhood name was Nobumaru.
His childhood name was Nobumaru.
His childhood name was Nobumaru.

sen.j: 東坊城家は菅原道真の末裔で高辻家五条家の流れを汲む公家。
sen.e: The Higashibojo family was offspring of Michizane SUGAWARA and was a kuge family (court noble) descended from the Takatsuji family and the Gojo family.
The Higashibojo family was offspring of SUGAWARA no Michizane and was a kuge family (court noble) descended from the Takatsuji family and the Gojo family.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞表記を統一させます。
sen.e: The Higashibojo family was offspring of SUGAWARA no Michizane and was a kuge family (court noble) descended from the Takatsuji family and the Gojo family.

sen.j: 五条為経の次男東坊城茂長を祖とする。
sen.e: The founder of the HIGASHIBOJO family was Shigenaga HIGASHIBOJO, the fifth son of Tametsune GOJO.
The founder of the Higashibojo family was Shigenaga HIGASHIBOJO, the second son of Tametsune GOJO.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞表記を統一させます。誤訳（写し間違い）があります。
sen.e: The founder of the Higashibojo family was Shigenaga HIGASHIBOJO, the second son of Tametsune GOJO.

sen.j: 明治17年8月8日に華族に列せられ子爵の爵位を授爵する。
sen.e: On August 8,1884, Yoshinaga was raised to the peerage and given the title of viscount.
On August 8,1884, Yoshinaga was raised to the peerage and given the title of viscount.
On August 8,1884, Yoshinaga was raised to the peerage and given the title of viscount.

sen.j: 後に宮中に仕え、御製取調掛・掌典・明治天皇御製臨時編纂部員・御歌所参候・御歌会始奉行等を歴任する。
sen.e: Later, he served the imperial court, working in various positions such as Gyosei-Torishirabegakari (student of poems produced by the Emperor), Shoten (conductor of court ceremonies), an ad hoc member for compiling products of the Emperor, Outadokoro-sanko (official of the Imperial Poetry Bureau) and Outakai-bugyo (the superintendent of the Imperial Poetry Reading Party).

Later, he served the imperial court working in various positions such as Gyosei-Torishirabe-gakari (poetry teacher for the imperial family), Shoten (conductor of court ceremonies), ad hoc member for compiling poems by Emperor Meiji, Outadokoro-sanko (official of the Imperial Poetry Bureau) and Outakai-bugyo (superintendent of the Imperial Poetry Reading Party).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ、訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Later, he served the imperial court working in various positions such as Gyosei-Torishirabe-gakari (poetry teacher for the imperial family), Shoten (conductor of court ceremonies), ad hoc member for compiling poems by Emperor Meiji, Outadokoro-sanko (official of the Imperial Poetry Bureau) and Outakai-bugyo (superintendent of the Imperial Poetry Reading Party).

sen.j: 明治44年子爵議員として貴族院議員に就任、研究会に属す。
sen.e: In 1911, Yoshinaga became a parliament member of Kizokuin and belonged to the Kenkyukai faction.
In 1911, Yoshinaga became a parliament member of Kizokuin and belonged to a faction.
sen.cmt: この場合は単にa factionで大丈夫です。
sen.e: In 1911, Yoshinaga became a parliament member of Kizokuin and belonged to a faction.

sen.j: 徳長の後を東坊城政長が継ぐ。
sen.e: Masanaga HIGASHIBOJO succeeded to Yoshinaga.
Masanaga HIGASHIBOJO succeeded to Yoshinaga.
Masanaga HIGASHIBOJO succeeded to Yoshinaga.

sen.j: 女優の入江たか子（本名：英子）は次女で、姉で長女の東坊城敏子は大正時代に貞明皇后付の女官として長年勤め、目黒雅叙園の創始者である細川力蔵に嫁いだ。
sen.e: Actress Takako IRIE (real name: Hideko) was his second daughter and his first daughter and Hideko's elder sister, Toshiko HIGASHIBOJO served as a court lady attending on Empress Teimei for a long time in the Taisho Era and was married to Rikozo HOSOKAWA, the founder of Meguro Gajoen.

Actress Takako IRIE (real name: Hideko) was his second daughter and his first daughter and Hideko's elder sister, Toshiko HIGASHIBOJO served Empress Teimei as court lady for a long time in the Taisho era and was married to Rikizo HOSOKAWA, the founder of Meguro Gajoen.
sen.cmt: 用語を統一します。写し間違いがあります。
sen.e: Actress Takako IRIE (real name: Hideko) was his second daughter and his first daughter and Hideko's elder sister, Toshiko HIGASHIBOJO served Empress Teimei as court lady for a long time in the Taisho era and was married to Rikizo HOSOKAWA, the founder of Meguro Gajoen.

sen.j: 東坊城恭長は息子、入江若葉は孫に当る。
sen.e: Yasunaga HIGASHIBOJO was his son and Wakaba IRIE is his granddaughter.
Yasunaga HIGASHIBOJO was his son and Wakaba IRIE is his granddaughter.
Yasunaga HIGASHIBOJO was his son and Wakaba IRIE is his granddaughter.

sen.j: 先祖の菅原道真を祀る大田神社奉賛会である東風会会長を明治35年より務める。
sen.e: From 1902, Yoshinaga was chairman of the patronage group, Tofukai, for Ota Shrine enshrining Michizane SUGAWARA, who was his ancestor.
Since 1902, Yoshinaga had assumed the position of chairman of Tofukai, the patronage group for Ota-jinja Shrine enshrining his ancestor SUGAWARA no Michizane.
sen.cmt: 用語を統一、わかりやすくします。
sen.e: Since 1902, Yoshinaga had assumed the position of chairman of Tofukai, the patronage group for Ota-jinja Shrine enshrining his ancestor SUGAWARA no Michizane.
